summary:
• Proven results in running international communication campaigns and building corporate reputation in multicultural and multifunctional environments with companies such as Intel, Microsoft, Pfizer, Coca-Cola, Severstal, and the Russian Post.

• Vast experience in developing and executing policies and government outreach programs on antimonopoly, FMCG regulations, excise duty, recycling, trademark, and market access issues across the EU, Russia, and the CIS.

• Built strong relationships at the EU level, including the European Commission, European Parliament, and national governments (Ireland, Germany, France, Poland, and Belgium), as well as with the US Government and key stakeholders in Russia, such as the President's Administration, Cabinet of the Prime Minister, Ministries of Health and Trade, and others.

• Successfully implemented programs in the areas of reformulation of ingredients, recycling, water stewardship, healthy living, secondary education reform, e-health, e-learning, women and youth economic empowerment, inclusivity, CO2 emissions, and corporate volunteering with Microsoft, Pfizer, Coca-Cola, and the Russian Post.

treasury_media.title: Golden guest - World Cup trophy lands at RT HQ in Moscow ahead of Russia 2018 (VIDEO)
treasury_media.description: The official World Cup trophy landed at RT HQ in Moscow on Tuesday after returning to Russia following a leviathan 143,000 km journey across 50 countries worldwide, making it the longest of its kind in history.

profile_positions.title: Global Head of External Affairs

profile_positions.description:
The First Place Communications Group is a leading communications, GR, and community initiatives agency in Russia, servicing major corporations, state owned companies, ministries, and government agencies.

•	Managing communications strategies and execution plans for global and local clients.
•	Building and supporting positive public perceptions of the client companies by creating positive public awareness, understanding and support for client’s business plans and initiatives, as well as effectively managing the client’s reputation and Government Relations impact with companies who’s key partners are based outside Russia. 
•	Responsible for building and maintaining partnership relationships with key stakeholder groups, including government officials, media, opinion leaders and community to help resolve complex issues and find common ground for the clients when their positions differ or even located on opposite sides. 
•	Developing and implementing an EU Commission tender on strategic communications and public diplomacy programs that advance EU’s mission, vision and objectives in Russia and Russia’s objectives in the EU.
•	Responsible for the organization of events and communications activities for Russia based and International clients to secure international credit rating, based on financial reporting and international profile, as well as its ability to attract international financing.
•	Planning and supervising the preparation of collateral materials such as reports, media and partner information packs, financial reports and presentations, news releases and other materials for clients in close coordination with their global offices.
•	Responsible for planning and supervising public opinion and insights research and analysis to inform and support communications and stakeholder relations strategies of the clients.
profile_positions.title: Global Public Affairs and Communications Director (GR, Public Affairs and Sustainability)

profile_positions.description:
Russian Post is a leading digital postal and logistics company, employing 350 thousand people in Russia. The company processes about 3.5 billion mail items annually. 

•	Development and execution of Public Affairs, GR, and communications strategy of the Company.
•	Improved the Company’s image in the media by 35%.
•	Strategic and day to day management of relationships with Federal Ministries, Regional Authorities, and Industry Associations.
•	Coordinating the implementation of the programs directed at the positioning of the Company and increasing its brand awareness.
•       Financial reporting and information disclosure.
•	Analysis of the impact of the communication activities on the perception of the Company among stakeholders and consumers and the adjustment of the Public Affairs Strategy of The Company accordingly
•	Media/issue monitoring, tracking and reporting and crisis management and resolution
•	PR agency management and budget allocation on communications and sustainability
•	Day-to-day management of communications activities across the 85 regions
•	Support internal teams and leadership communication needs. Build leadership personal band
•	Media, Key Opinion Leaders relations and external events management
•	Provision of full editorial support (editing, proofreading and revision of texts.) for corporate and business needs
•	Management of the data collection and analysis of the economic, socio-political, and sociological information related to the activities of the Company.
•	Development and coordination of The Company’s sustainability strategy.
•	Coordinated preparations of the meeting of the CEO with the President.
•	Serving as a trusted counsel to the Board of Directors and the Executive Committee.
profile_positions.title: Director, Head of Public Affairs

profile_positions.description:
THE COCA-COLA COMPANY (NYSE: KO) is a leading beverage company, offering over 500 brands in more than 200 countries and territories.

Drove stakeholder relations, strengthened corporate reputation, and increased Brand visibility.
•	Led the Coca-Cola System Reputation growth to the highest ever level since 2014.
•	Drove high Brand awareness and visibility. 9,000+ media publications in 2 years, reaching 1,75+ Billion views. Coca- Cola was recognized as the most mentioned brand in traditional and social media, helping to drive corporate approval and brand equity.
•	Facilitated Coca-Cola’s engagement of the President of Russia for the first time ever. Established 100+ GO (including 20 Governors of the key regions) and 50+ non-government meaningful contacts to help to drive partnership and advocacy.
•	Lead and facilitated engagement with the Federal Ministries, Presidential Administration and Regional Authorities) on business related issues (sugar tax, recycling and self-regulation, transportation restrictions, advertising, and sales restrictions).
•	Lead institutional partnerships with government ministries and NGOs on the proposed National Healthy Living Strategy and Recycling.
•	Strengthened Coca-Cola’s key influencers/opinion leaders relationships.
•	Led the creation of a positive community legacy: 1. Inclusivity; 2. Recycling; 3. Youth Football Development.
•	Drove internal communications to contribute to over 90% of employees’ engagement rate.
•	Ensured no negative reports and stakeholder issues through leading/contributing to the dedicated incident management and crisis resolution process.
profile_positions.title: Head of Public Affairs and Communications

profile_positions.description:
THE COCA-COLA COMPANY (NYSE: KO) is a leading beverage company, offering over 500 brands in more than 200 countries and territories.
 
As Region Public Affairs and Communications Director was responsible for building/protecting Coca-Cola’s reputation and business development in the region.
•	Setup and developed GR, Public Affairs, Communications and CSR functions to effectively contribute to protecting Coca-Cola’s reputation and growing business in the region.
•	Achieved 15+% growth of Category Perception and Brand Love, highest since the start of the business in the region.
•	Drove a 20+% growth of Corporate Trust in the Region. 
•	Established partnership/advocacy relationships with the Presidential Administrations and Ministries/Municipalities in Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Armenia, Georgia, Tajikistan and Turkmenistan.
•	Implemented a partnership with the Ministry of Health of Kazakhstan and the National Academy of Nutrition on balanced diet, sufficient water consumption, and active and healthy leaving to mitigate restrictive nature of the proposed National Health Strategy.
•	Implemented a partnership with Ministry of Social Affairs of Kazakhstan and the G-Global NGO on economic women empowerment to help build a positive reputation for Coca-Cola with key government, partners, customers, and opinion leaders.
•	Successfully resolved issues with the Trademark protection in Kazakhstan, currency conversion in Uzbekistan and sales restrictions in Azerbaijan.
•	Developed relations with key media. Increased ten-fold positive media coverage of the Company’s business and sustainability initiatives, while decreasing the number of negative reports to less than 3%.
•	Coordinated the set-up of the Social Community Management process (VK, Facebook and Instagram) in the region.
•	Drove internal engagement/motivation to over 93%.
•	Led Incident Management and Crisis Resolution teams to effectively assess risks and manage crises situations.
profile_positions.title: Region Public Affairs and Communications Director, Caucasus and Central Asia

profile_positions.description:
PCI – EUROPE is an exclusive high-level consultancy providing strategic advice to Major Corporations in the EU. Jointly run by former President of the European Parliament Pat Cox.

•	Providing strategic guidance on European Affairs to Major Transatlantic Corporations and B2B networking.
•	Providing executive level EU affairs consulting on strategic framework, planning processes and intelligence to Major Corporations (Intel, Microsoft, Michelin and Pfizer). 
•	Successfully managed corporate responsibility initiatives of the Intel Corporation.
•	Successful execution of a business communication and media campaign for the second Lisbon Treaty Referendum in Ireland. Delivered a 17% contribution to the “Yes” vote.
•	Assisting private sector clients in making strategic business to business and business to government contacts in the ICT and construction sector.
•	Set up coordination mechanism for the Translational Biomedical Research and Innovation Hub in Dublin. Devised a clear national and international profile and visibility. Generated contacts and leads for funding from the Exchequer and the European Union.
•	Managed relations with key European Government and Non-Governmental contacts.
profile_positions.title: Partner & Senior Executive

profile_positions.description:
UNIVERSITY OF LIMERICK is a leading third-level education center.

•	Assisting in developing external policies with a view to recruitment of non-national students with a special focus on Eastern Europe.
•	Delivering lectures in the module of the International Organization and Global Governance.
•	Setting and correction of examinations.
profile_positions.title: Adviser to Vice-President External/Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT is an important forum for political debate and decision-making at the EU level.

•	Carrying out background research
•	Compilation of country reports and briefings
•	Drafting addresses and messages
•	Drafting written interviews
